highlights.description: Security fix for open URL redirect vulnerability in OAuth2 server

security.description: Close open URL redirect vulnerability in `isValidRedirectURI` - wildcards no longer allow arbitrary redirect URIs

fixed.description: OAuth2 redirect URI validation now properly parses and validates URIs structurally

highlights.description: Project renamed to MCPKit under github.com/agentplexus/mcpkit
Improved error handling following Go best practices

changed.description: Core runtime code moved to `runtime/` subpackage - import `github.com/agentplexus/mcpkit/runtime`
OAuth2 server moved from `oauth2server/` to `oauth2/` - import `github.com/agentplexus/mcpkit/oauth2`
Package references changed from `mcpkit.` to `runtime.` for runtime types

fixed.description: Error handling for `fmt.Fprintf` in OAuth login error page
Error handling for `resp.Body.Close()` in all test files

breaking.description: Package name changed: update `mcpruntime.` or `mcpkit.` references to `runtime.`
OAuth2 server import path changed: update `oauth2server` to `github.com/agentplexus/mcpkit/oauth2`

highlights.description: OAuth 2.1 Authorization Code + PKCE support for ChatGPT.com and other MCP clients requiring user authentication
HTTP server mode with optional ngrok tunnel for public URL exposure
Bearer token authentication for protecting MCP endpoints

added.description: `ServeHTTP()` method for HTTP transport with graceful shutdown
`NgrokOptions` for automatic ngrok tunnel creation with custom domain support
`OAuth2Options` for OAuth 2.1 Authorization Code + PKCE authentication
`oauth2server` package implementing RFC 7636 (PKCE), RFC 7591 (DCR), RFC 8414, RFC 9728
Bearer token authentication middleware for protected MCP endpoints
`HTTPServerResult` with local and public URLs plus OAuth credentials
`OnReady` callback in `HTTPServerOptions` for server lifecycle events

deprecated.description: `OAuthOptions` (client_credentials only) in favor of `OAuth2Options` with full OAuth 2.1 PKCE support

highlights.description: Library-first MCP runtime: define tools, prompts, and resources once, invoke them directly as Go functions or expose over MCP transports
Zero JSON-RPC overhead in library mode for unit testing, embedding, and serverless use cases
Full MCP SDK compatibility with escape hatch for advanced features

added.description: `Runtime` type wrapping `mcp.Server` with dual execution modes (library and server)
`MCPServer()` escape hatch for advanced MCP SDK access
`AddTool[In, Out]()` generic helper with automatic schema inference
`AddResourceTemplate()` for dynamic URI template resources (server mode only)
`InMemorySession()` for testing with full MCP semantics

documentation.description: Comprehensive README with library and server mode examples
Feature comparison matrix (library vs server mode)
